bn.base

Class CPT

  • java.lang.Object
    • bn.base.CPT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CPT

    public class CPT
extends java.lang.Object
implements CPT
    Base implementation of a conditional probability table (CPT) as a Map from Assignments to Distributions.

    Per AIMA, for finite, discrete distributions, we use a table with one row for every combination of Values for the parents (an Assignment), and a column for each Value of the CPT's variable (a Distribution).

    CPTs are also used to store prior Distributions for variables with no parents. In that case there is one entry in the map, with an empty Assignment, and probabilities for each of the variable's Values.

      • getRowForAssignment

        protected Distribution getRowForAssignment(Assignment a)
        Return the ``row'' (Distribution) for the given Assignment in this CPT. We can't just use the assignment as the key to find the row, since it may contain entries for other variables besides just our parents. Using ArrayMaps for Assignments, the entrySet has to be created from the underlying ArrayList. The default implementation in AbstractSet is probably expensive, making this expensive. Sigh.

      • addRowForAssignment

        protected Distribution addRowForAssignment(Assignment a)
        Add a ``row'' (Distribution) for the given Assignment to this CPT.

      • get

        public double get(Value value,
                  Assignment assignment)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the probability of the given Value for this CPT's RandomVariable, given the values of its parents in the given Assignment. Note that the assignment may contain values for variables other than this CPT's variable (but it must contain at least values for the parents or an error will occur). Throws IllegalArgumentException if there is no entry for the given Assignment and Value in this CPT.
        Specified by:
        get in interface CPT
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
